intro: Parasenegalia, commonly known as the parasitic plant of the genus, is a group of flowering plants that exhibit hemiparasitic behavior. These plants typically rely on other plants for some of their nutritional needs, often through specialized root structures called haustoria that attach to host roots. They are found primarily in tropical and subtropical regions, where they can thrive in shaded or moist environments. The genus includes several species that are of interest to botanists due to their unique ecological interactions and adaptations. Their study contributes to understanding plant parasitism and ecosystem dynamics.
